column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Saver Plus is a matched savings and financial education program developed in 2003 by ANZ and the Brotherhood of St Laurence. The Saver Plus program supports lower income earners in building a savings habit, accessing financial education, and receiving matched savings of up to $500 from ANZ to support their own, or their children's, education. This year, Saver Plus celebrated 20 years of improving people's financial well-being by expanding from 60 individual sites to a national online program.
column20: Saver Plus, financial education, lower income earner

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: ANZ's workplace giving program enables employees in Australia to make contributions to around 30 charity partners aligned to its focus areas of financial well-being, housing and environmental sustainability through regular or once-off pre-tax payroll deductions. Donations are 'double matched' Ã¢ÂÂ ANZ donates two dollars for every dollar donated by an employee (up to $5,000 per employee in a tax year).
column20: Workplace giving, charity partner, financial well-being

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year marks the 20th anniversary of ANZ's partnership with the Foundation for Rural and Regional Renewal (FRRR) to deliver the ANZ Seeds of Renewal program, with more organisations across Australia receiving grants in 2023. The program provides grants of up to $15,000 to help build vibrant and sustainable communities in regional Australia. ANZ funded $250,000 in community grants shared between 20 projects this year.
column20: ANZ Seeds of Renewal, Foundation for Rural and Regional Renewal, sustainable community

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year, ANZ's digital giving platform Shout for Good, which supports charities in Australia with free and innovative digital fundraising solutions, facilitated over $15.3 million in donations for more than 390 charities. In 2023, Shout for Good launched a dedicated ticketing component to their existing product suite, which allows charities to set up and sell digital tickets to fundraising events.
column20: Shout for Good, digital fundraising, charity

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year, ANZ financial relief packages for customers in Australia affected by floods. In January, ANZ donated $50,000 to local organisations for flood recovery efforts in the Kimberley/Derby region. In addition, ANZ donated NZ$100,000 to the Auckland Mayoral Relief Fund to support local communities impacted by the January flooding event and pledged NZ$3 million in donations to communities affected by Cyclone Gabrielle.
column20: Financial relief packages, flood, Auckland Mayoral Relief Fund

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: ANZ supports its customers and communities to manage and recover from natural disasters. ANZ's Disaster Relief and Recovery Policy guides an efficient, coordinated, and proportionate disaster response. The Policy encompasses a range of measures, including charitable donations, hardship assistance, financial advice and employee volunteering to assist with community rebuilding.
column20: Disaster Relief and Recovery Policy, natural disaster, disaster response

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: ANZ launched the Te Waka-ÃÂ-Reo, ANZ's own Reo MÃÂori program. The online and facilitated language courses were designed to increase proficiency and confidence in the language, with more than 1,200 online modules completed this year.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: ANZ released its Watch WÃÂhine Win report, which recognised and celebrated the women who make up New Zealand's rich cultural fabric. It also restated ANZ's support for MÃÂori women to build their path to a better future through economic equality.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year, ANZ hosted Dame Annette King (the High Commissioner of New Zealand to Australia), who, alongside ANZ CEO Shayne Elliott, opened the ANZ Te Tiriti O Waitangi (the Treaty of Waitangi) Exhibition at ANZ's headquarters in Melbourne. The art exhibition recognised the 40th Anniversary of the Australia-New Zealand Closer Economic Relationship Trade Agreement between Aotearoa, New Zealand, and Australia.
column20: Te Tiriti O Waitangi, art exhibition, trade agreement

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: Since 2005, ANZ has measured the dollar value of its community investment following the Business for Societal Impact Framework (formerly known as London Benchmarking Group), a widely adopted standard for measuring and managing social impact. In 2023, ANZ's community investment was $141.6 million.
column20: Business for Societal Impact Framework, community investment, social impact

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: ANZ offers an at-call interpreter service, delivered by an independent provider, that staff can contact to assist customers with limited English. Overall, customer experience and response times have improved, with a broad range of languages and a high-quality interpretation provided.
column20: Interpreter service, high-quality interpretation, independent provider

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: ANZ's Australian Customer Complaints Guide is available in Easy to Read English and a range of languages, including Auslan format, to support customers whose first language is not English, people with cognitive impairment or low language literacy, and customers who are deaf or hard of hearing. ANZ has seen strong customer use of these accessible formats, representing over 32% of downloads this year.
column20: Australian Customer Complaints Guide, Auslan format, cognitive impairment

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: In 2023, ANZ improved its credit risk assessment process via the Online Customer Profile platform by integrating its Social and Environmental Risk screening tool for large business customers. It allows ANZ to improve its identification of financial and non-financial risks (including reputational risk) it may face through customer activities, both at an individual customer level and across its portfolio.
column20: Online Customer Profile, credit risk assessment, non-financial risk

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
Political contributions
column7: In 2023, ANZ contributed $97,159 to participate in political activities hosted by the Australian Labor Party, the Liberal Party of Australia and the National Party of Australia.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column7: ANZ considers this disclosure as not material through its stakeholder engagement process.

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column13: ANZ updated its terms and conditions for savings and transactions products, including ANZ Plus, to clarify that financial abuse will not be tolerated. ANZ will take action to suspend, cancel or deny access to an account if a customer uses it to cause harm.
column20: Terms and conditions, ANZ Plus, financial abuse

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning product and service information and labeling
column13: ANZ's Customer Advocate function leads the Customer Advocacy Forum. The Customer Advocacy Forum monitors and oversees identified and emerging issues that may impact retail or small business customers, focusing on influencing fair customer outcomes and limiting customer harm and detriment.
column20: Customer Advocacy Forum, Customer Advocate function, small business customer

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning marketing communications
column13: In 2022, the Brotherhood of St Laurence (BSL) invited ANZ to participate in the "Chance For All" pilot, which expands on the Given the Chance program to include people with disability, recognising the barriers to employment that this Group can also experience. Three of the eight pilot participants continued their careers with ANZ this year.
column20: Chance for All, Given the Chance, disability

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: ANZ worked with major telecommunications companies to activate anti-spoofing technologies such as the Do Not Originate (DNO) service and technology to prevent scammers from using the "ANZ" brand in text messages. This practice, known as 'spoofing', has become increasingly common in Australia and involves scammers sending an SMS purporting to be from a legitimate organisation, making it very difficult to spot a scam because it is contained in the same text message thread as the previous communication from the company being impersonated.
column20: Anti-spoofing technology, DNO service, scammer

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: As an extension to its behavioural biometrics technology delivered last year, ANZ invested in a new security capability designed to detect mule accounts used to receive funds from scam victims and other criminal activities. The mule detection capability uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to recognise money mules and mule accounts.
column20: Mule account detecting, behavioural biometrics technology, scam victim

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: ANZ funded and promoted a television education series, "You've Been Scammed", to educate consumers on better protecting themselves. It was the fourth most popular show on TVNZ in the month it aired.
column20: You've Been Scammed, television education series, TVNZ

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: ANZ's targeted education program has been extended to include a network of 634 cyber security ambassadors from across the organisation and more than 50 divisional representatives who help embed security across the organisation. These representatives share security education resources to promote and support improved security behaviours across ANZ, including with customers, leading to a 36.2% increase in the internal index it uses to measure security behaviours.
column20: Security ambassador, targeted education program, security education

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: This year, ANZ evolved its comprehensive phishing resilience and capability program, including regular simulated exercises and phishing drills to educate all staff about detecting suspicious emails aiming to phish for information. Drills and exercises are increasing in frequency and complexity, informed by threat intelligence to enable readiness against growing sophistication.
column20: Phishing resilience and capability program, phishing drill, suspicious email

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: ANZ's customer security education service includes training frontline bankers to recognise new scams and helping them engage with and support customers. ANZ also directly enables customers through educational resources and regular alerts in its digital and branch channels. The education program includes events and seminars, webinars, tips, guides and continued alerts in digital banking channels, social media and via the frontline to drive awareness of increasing scams.
column20: Customer security education service, frontline banker, educational resource

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: ANZ's data event management processes are focused on potential and actual data breaches and how it can rapidly respond to and mitigate the risk of harm to individuals. Data event root cause analysis, post-incident reviews, and up-to-date threat intelligence are combined to ensure continuous improvement and fine-tuning of ANZ's approach to data protection, privacy compliance, incident management and education for individuals.
column20: Data event management, data breach, root cause analysis
